solution_line_template: For the first year, Joseph will have invested ${initial_investment} + (${monthly_deposit} * {months_per_year}) = $<<{initial_investment}+{monthly_deposit}*{months_per_year}={first_year_total_invested}>>{first_year_total_invested}.

The interest calculated for the first year will be ${first_year_total_invested} * {interest_rate_percent}% = $<<{first_year_total_invested}*{interest_rate_percent}*{percent_factor}={first_year_interest}>>{first_year_interest}.

The total value of the investment for the first year will be ${first_year_total_invested} + ${first_year_interest} = $<<{first_year_total_invested}+{first_year_interest}={first_year_total_value}>>{first_year_total_value}.

For the second year, the total invested will be ${first_year_total_value} + (${monthly_deposit} * {months_per_year}) = $<<{first_year_total_value}+{monthly_deposit}*{months_per_year}={second_year_total_invested}>>{second_year_total_invested}.

The interest calculated after the second year will be ${second_year_total_invested} * {interest_rate_percent}% = $<<{second_year_total_invested}*{interest_rate_percent}*{percent_factor}={second_year_interest}>>{second_year_interest}.

Therefore, Joseph's investment in the mutual fund will be worth ${second_year_total_invested} + ${second_year_interest} = $<<{second_year_total_invested}+{second_year_interest}={total_after_two_years}>>{total_after_two_years}.
